author: Dinorath Mota López
title: Hidalgo registra 4 incendios de hierba y pastizal en varios municipios; emiten alerta de prevención | El Universal
text:
Pachuca.— Al menos cuatro incendios de hierba y pastizal se han registrado en las últimas horas en el estado de Hidalgo , uno de los cuales originó la evacuación de estudiantes y personal administrativo de la Universidad Politécnica de Pachuca. De acuerdo con la Secretaría del Medio Ambiente y los ayuntamientos, este día se reportaron varias conflagraciones en los municipios de Ajacuba, Epazoyucan, Atotonilco y Acaxochitlán, donde pastizales y hierba seca fueron arrasados en minutos por el fuego.
En el caso de Epazoyucan , se informó que el incendio registrado cerca de la Universidad Politécnica motivó que las autoridades educativas implementaran el protocolo de emergencia para desalojar a la comunidad universitaria. Esta es la segunda ocasión en que alumnos y docentes deben ser evacuados por un siniestro de este tipo en esa casa de estudios.
Lee también Hidalgo actualiza su Programa Estatal de Acción ante el Cambio Climático
Al menos 4 incendios de hierba y pastizal se han registrado en las últimas horas en Hidalgo (07/05/2025). Foto: Especial En el municipio de Ajacuba, específicamente en la comunidad Emiliano Zapata, elementos de Protección Civil del ayuntamiento atienden otro incendio, con el apoyo de la Comisión Nacional Forestal y brigadas comunitarias. Hasta el momento, se reportó que no hay riesgo para la población.
Mientras tanto, en Acaxochitlán, en un sitio conocido como Zotitla, personal de la Secretaría del Medio Ambiente realiza labores de combate a otro incendio, al igual que en el municipio de Atotonilco, donde vecinos reportaron un siniestro en zona de pastizales.
Las autoridades emitieron una alerta para reforzar las acciones de prevención, ya que las condiciones meteorológicas de viento y altas temperaturas agravan el riesgo. Según datos de la Comisión Nacional del Agua ( Conagua ) en Hidalgo, se esperan hasta 40 °C en la región Huasteca, 38 °C en la Sierra, 37 °C en la región Tepehua, 34 °C en el Valle del Mezquital y alrededor de 30 °C en Pachuca y Tizayuca.
Badiraguato, Sinaloa: Dos niñas mueren en fuego cruzado contra fuerzas estatales y federales; esto es lo que sabemos del caso

author: News Agency Of Nigeria
title: PDP demands arrest, prosecution of suspended Adamawa INEC REC | Pulse Nigeria
text: Recommended articles The opposition party said arresting and prosecuting Yunusa-Yari would be in obedience to an earlier court order. The party‘s National Publicity Secretary, Debo Ologunagba, made the call during a news conference on Thursday in Abuja. Yunusa-Ari was suspended over an attempt to usurp the powers of the state returning officer when he declared the All Progressives Congress, (APC) Governorship Candidate, Aishatu Binani, winner of the April 15, 2023 Adamawa governorship election. At the point of the declaration, the collation of the election results was incomplete. Ologunagba described the action as a civilian coup and an attempt to subvert Nigeria’s constitutional democracy. The High Court of Justice of Adamawa State, No. 9, Yola Division has issued a Warrant of Arrest for Yunusa-Ari dated May 21, 2024. The court ordered the IGP to apprehend and produce Yunusa-Ari before it to answer the charges preferred against him. The order of the court was received by the office of the IGP on May 23. He said that since the removal of Yunusa-Ari, he has been on the run, forgetting the saying that “time they say, does not run against the State in criminal matters.” He said the delay in the prosecution of Yunusa-Ari constituted a clear and present danger to Nigeria’s democracy and the rule of law. “The failure of the Nigerian police so far to apprehend and bring Yunusa-Ari to justice is capable of creating bad precedence and encouraging other public officers to act with impunity. “There is a tendency for them to behave as if there are no consequences for acts contrary to law and their Oath of Office’’, he said. The PDP, therefore, charged the IGP to, in compliance with the order of the court, immediately locate, arrest and bring Yunusa-Ari before the court for prosecution. “This is especially true as there are allegations and apprehension in the public space that Yunusa-Ari has perfected plans to escape from the country and evade trial. “The PDP insists that Yunusa-Ari must be made to face the full wrath of the law for his assault against our democracy,” he said.

organizations.name: high court of justice of adamawa state

title: 擎AI之"笔"，助力人工智能与美育"破界共生"-新华网
text:
人工智能的浪潮正给我们的生活带来翻天覆地的变化，从智慧校园到智能城市，从未来探索到人机协作，AI技术正在描绘一幅充满无限可能的未来图景。
　　北京有这样一群大学生，以“数智化教育在行动”为主题，将人工智能技术与设计艺术相结合，推出“青少年ICT与艺术融合科普计划”。
　　帮助青少年打开人工智能的世界，助力人工智能与美育“破界共生”。
　　作者：王普、马洋、郗小超
　　画面来源：北京邮电大学数字媒体与设计艺术学院
　　新华社音视频部制作
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: Abbas Adil
title: No pause to Genocide: 27 more martyred in Gaza – Shafaqna India | Indian Shia News Agency
text: Shafaqna India: Israeli forces have intensified their operations in the central and southern Gaza Strip, clashing with Hamas fighters. On Thursday, Palestinian health officials reported that Israeli strikes had killed at least 27 people across Gaza. The escalation follows a recent push by US President Joe Biden, who urged Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to prioritize a truce and the release of prisoners. Concurrently, US and Israeli teams began new discussions in Cairo on Thursday to negotiate a ceasefire deal. Despite months of intermittent talks, both Israel and Hamas remain entrenched in their positions. In Beit Lahiya in northern Gaza, a strike on a house resulted in the deaths of 11 people, including children and women, some of whom were reportedly burned. Another strike in Al-Maghazi camp in the central Gaza Strip killed six, including a local journalist. Additional strikes in the south resulted in five more deaths. Later in the day, an airstrike near Khan Younis killed five Palestinians and injured several others. The Israeli military reported that its forces have increased their activity in Deir Al-Balah and Khan Younis, demolishing numerous structures and claiming to have killed 50 fighters in Rafah over the past 24 hours. Hamas’s armed wing responded by ambushing an Israeli force in Rafah, resulting in casualties on both sides. In Deir Al-Balah, tanks have advanced from the east, blocking roads and forcing residents to flee their homes, with some finding temporary shelter on roads or beaches. The situation is further complicated by ongoing negotiations in Cairo, where US and Israeli delegations are working on a truce proposal. Discussions are focusing on border security arrangements, with Egyptian and Qatari officials expected to join the talks. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s recent visit to the region did not yield a breakthrough, and negotiations continue to face significant obstacles, particularly regarding Israeli troop deployment in Gaza and along the Egypt-Gaza border.
